what is wine?: can i install it on ubuntu?
what is the difference between wine and qemu?
wine is a compatibility layer and doesn't need you to install windows on it.  qemu requires that you install windows on it
you have to install windows in qemu to run windows stuff.  Wine doesn't need you to install windows in it
it's because of dhclient automatically setting DNS servers.  To fix that, change the prepend domain-name-servers setting in /etc/dhcp3/dhclient.conf
add this to the bottom: prepend domain-name-servers <first-ip>,<second-ip>;
if the first ip were 192.168.1.1 and the second were 10.0.0.1, add "prepend domain-name-servers 192.168.1.1,10.0.0.1;"
just add the line that I told you to add at the end of the file
it doesn't matter where it is, as long as it's on a separate line
you can still change the DNS settings
